channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.description:
Report X-2023110023

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE BOTTOM OF PACKAGE WAS WET DescribePack: BOTTOM WAS WET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: REMOVED FORM THE BELT AND MOVED TO HAZ DAMAGE CAGE FOR INSPECTION

item.title: Report X-2023101380
item.description:
Report X-2023101380

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection, there's four 1 Gallon plastic bottles of heavy duty coil cleaner inside a fiberboard box. The caps were loose on two causing the liquid to leak throughout the box. Due to the leakage the box was wet and began to rip apart. The UNPOP # was not visible because of the leakage. DescribePack: Loose caps on two of the 1 gallon plastic bottles. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: The four plastic bottles, damaged fiberboard box were individually packed inside plastic hazardous material bags and placed inside a yellow salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023101357
item.description:
Report X-2023101357

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with the bottom flaps open and a bit wet with annatto extract. Upon inspection, it was found that 1 of 4 bottles containing the annatto extract had a slight loose cap causing for the slight leakage. Bottles were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The bottle failure was a slight loose cap causing a slight less than 1/4th of leakage of the annatto extract. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were placed upright into a salvage drum and lids were secured tightly.

item.title: Report X-2023101354
item.description:
Report X-2023101354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101354 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WAS 4 BOTTLES OF RAPICDE. TWO OF PART B AND TWO OF PART A. THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF PART B AND DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP APPROXIAMTELY 0.5 (1/2) OF A CUP ENDED UP LEAKING OUT CAUSING THE BOX ITSELF TO GET TORN AND WET AS WELL. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. 2. X-2023101358 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE BOX WAS WET AND TORN ON THE BOTTOM SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER SO I COULD SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THERE WERE 4 BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. TWO OF THEM WERE RAPICIDE PART A AND THE OTHER TWO WERE RAPICIDE PART B. ONE OF THAT BOTTLES OF THE PART B SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER BOTTLES AND ONTO THE BOX ITSELD. APPROXIAMTELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY FASHION.

item.title: Report X-2023101352
item.description:
Report X-2023101352

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the box was found falling apart and completely soaked. Wet OP900 ad Packing slip was recovered. 1 of 2 Bottles containing "Noble Low Temp San" was found leaked out about half way. The bottles were placed into a salvage drum to await proper disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to be from a loose cap and being dropped or put upside down, causing the bottle to leak out half way. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected to salvage any information and to prevent further leakage. The bottles were then placed upright into a salvage drum to await proper disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023101323
item.description:
Report X-2023101323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag wet and the box falling apart. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 bottles containing "Zep acidic toilet bowl cleaner" was found a little lighter than the remaining 3. The bottles were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to no seals on the bottles (Improper preparation for transportation). It cause the bottle to leak out 1/4th of the bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were closed tightly and placed upright in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023101316
item.description:
Report X-2023101316

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the hazmat package arrived at the hazmat cage with wet orange like stains. Upon inspection, 1 out of 4 of the plastic bottles containing "sensient annatto extract" was found to have leaked out causing the soiled bottle to soil the box. The bottles were placed into a salvage drum to be processed and sent back to the shipper, unless otherwise. DescribePack: The Plastic bottle of annatto extract failure was due to a slight loose cap upon being dropped and the bottle not having a seal causing less than a quarter of the annatto dye to leak and soil the bottle and box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were closed tightly and placed into a salvage drum upward to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023101000
item.description:
Report X-2023101000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023100981
item.description:
Report X-2023100981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100981 SequenceEvent: Package was found in a truck that came back from deliveries. It was then put in a red tote and hazmat bag and placed in the hazmat cage for processing. This happened on 10/10/2023 about 14:oo. DescribePack: The package was wet and deteriorating. One of the 5-liter bottles that was in the box had a loose cap. It leaked in and out of the box, wetting a couple of other hazmat boxes. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a red Hazmat tote and Hazmat bag. It was then taken to the Hazmat cage, where it was processed. 2. X-2023101000 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS UPSIDE DOWN AND THAT IT WAS ALSO WET. MANAGER IMMEDICATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO PROPERLY SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO START THE REPACK PROCESS. DescribePack: THE BOX ITSELF WAS UPSIDE DOWN, ARROWS FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION AND EVERYTHING. TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE WERE ALSO FACING THE WRONG DIRECTION. ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING IT TO LEAK. APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT ONTO CAUSING THE BOX TO BE ALL WET AND START RIPPING APART. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: MANAGER TAKING PACKAGE IMMEDICATELY OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN CALLING ME OVER. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023100895
item.description:
Report X-2023100895

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on van line oily. Box was isolated from sort by manager. As box is unlabeled/hazmat undeclared, manager placed box into a black non-hazmat bin to transfer to QA cage. DescribePack: Outer package is oily, but otherwise appears undamaged; there are no puncture marks or tears on the outer box. Items packed very loosely in box with minimal packing material. No hazmat stickers or indicators on box or label. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon delivery to QA cage, QA inspected package, discovering undeclared aerosol hazmat. Package was transferred to a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Leak almost 100% contained within box; smear of oil on belt cleaned with disposable absorbent cloth pads.

item.title: Report X-2023100870

DescribePack: Inspection of "BRANSON EC FORMULATED CLEANING CONCENTRATE" showed box to be wet and torn open with 3 of 4 contents missing. Damage most likely from being dropped or mishandled and torn open, causing inner bottles to be lost. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper, unless otherwise stated.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package of "SIGMA ALDRICH METHANOL" to be wet from internal leakage, most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled during the unload process. item.title: Report X-2023100838
item.description:
Report X-2023100838

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler notified management that package was leaking. Acid neutralizing absorbent powder was placed down on and around spill. Hazmat was then placed in a plastic hazmat bag and red tub and brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection. Powder was swept up and placed in hazmat bag, zip tied and brought to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Two bottles of liquid had cracks in them on the outside approximately half way down the sides. Both bottles were on the same side of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Acid neutralizing absorbent powder was placed down on and around spill. Hazmat was then placed in a plastic hazmat bag and red tub and brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection.
